intro: Osbeckia crepiniana, commonly known as the creeping willow or creeping osbeckia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender,匍匐 (creeping) stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom in early summer. Osbeckia crepiniana is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, disturbed soils.
